definition[0]: to prepare or produce something by collecting pieces of information, ideas etc
example[0]: It took all morning to put the proposal together.
definition[1]: to form people or things into a group
example[1]: We are currently putting together a sales and marketing team.
definition[2]: to make a machine, model etc by joining all the different parts
example[2]: I can’t work out how to put this table together.
definition[3]: used to say that one amount is greater than the total of a set of amounts
example[3]: Paul seemed to have more money than the rest of us put together.
